parts: Can I use Adobe Acrobat PDF reader to view & print PDF documents for free? I do not need any editing or any AI capabilities

Yes — **Adobe Acrobat Reader (the free version)** is **completely sufficient** for **viewing and printing PDFs**, and you can do both **without paying anything**.

Here’s the clear breakdown:

## ✅ What you *can* do for free with Adobe Acrobat Reader
- **Open and view PDFs**
- **Print PDFs**
- **Search text inside PDFs**
- **Fill out forms (including many interactive ones)**
- **Add comments/annotations (highlight, sticky notes, basic markup)**
- **Sign documents electronically**

None of these require a subscription.

## ❌ What *requires* a paid subscription (Acrobat Standard/Pro)
- Editing text or images inside a PDF  
- Converting PDFs to Word/Excel/PowerPoint formats  
- Creating or merging PDFs  
- OCR (scanning text from images or scanned PDFs)  
- AI Assistant features

Since you explicitly mentioned **no editing and no AI**, the free version is all you need.

## ✔️ Recommendation
Just install **Adobe Acrobat Reader DC** (free) from Adobe’s website. Ignore the upsell buttons during installation — the core viewing/printing features are permanently free.

If you want, I can also recommend lighter alternatives (SumatraPDF, Foxit Reader, etc.) that are faster and less bloated than Adobe’s reader.
